intro: Mao Zedong (毛泽东) was the founding leader of the People's Republic of China and led the Chinese Communist Party to power in 1949.
Deng Xiaoping (邓小平) was a Chinese leader who pioneered economic reforms that opened China to the global market, transforming its economy in the late 20th century.
Yao Ming (姚明) is a retired Chinese basketball player who became an international star in the NBA and helped popularize basketball in China.
Ma Yun (马云), known as Jack Ma, is a Chinese entrepreneur who co-founded Alibaba and transformed e-commerce in China.
Cheng Long (成龙), known as Jackie Chan, is a Chinese actor and martial artist famous for transforming the action-comedy film genre.
Gong Li (巩俐) is a renowned Chinese actress known for her acclaimed roles in films like Raise the Red Lantern and Memoirs of a Geisha.
Mo Yan (莫言) is a Chinese novelist and Nobel laureate in Literature, acclaimed for his magical realism in works such as Red Sorghum.
Liu Cixin (刘慈欣) is a Chinese science fiction author and the first Asian to win the Hugo Award for Best Novel, best known for his Three-Body Problem trilogy.
Ai Weiwei (艾未未) is a Chinese contemporary artist and activist known for his provocative works that challenge political and social issues in China and around the world.
Li An (李安), known as Ang Lee in English, is a Taiwanese filmmaker acclaimed for his diverse body of work, including Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon and Brokeback Mountain.
Gao Xingjian (高行健) is a Chinese-French novelist and playwright who won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2000, best known for his novel Soul Mountain.
Li Xiaolong (李小龙), known as Bruce Lee, was a Hong Kong-American martial artist, actor and philosopher.
Zhang Yimou (张艺谋) is a film director known for works like Hero and House of Flying Daggers, influential in global cinema.
Yang Zhenning (杨振宁), known as Chen-Ning Yang or Frank Yang, is a theoretical physicist who won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1957 for his work on the laws of parity in particle physics.

Wu Jianxiong (吴健雄), known as Chien-Shiung Wu, was a Chinese-American physicist often called the "First Lady of Physics" for her groundbreaking work in nuclear and particle physics, especially in parity violation.
Li Na (李娜) is a former professional tennis player, winner of two Grand Slam singles titles, and one of China's most famous athletes.
Jin Yong (金庸), pen name Louis Cha, was a renowned Chinese author of wuxia (martial arts) novels, greatly influencing Chinese-speaking culture.
Xu Zhimo (徐志摩) was one of China's most famous poets, known for his modernist poetry in the early 20th century.
Tu Youyou (屠呦呦) is a Nobel Prize-winning pharmacologist recognized for discovering artemisinin, a life-saving treatment for malaria. She is the first Chinese woman to win a Nobel in science.
Lang Lang (郎朗) is a world-renowned Chinese pianist, celebrated for his performances on global stages.
Guo Pei (郭培) is a renowned Chinese fashion designer, known for her extravagant designs and for dressing celebrities, including Rihanna at the 2015 Met Gala.
Yang Liwei (杨利伟) is the first Chinese astronaut to travel into space, marking China’s significant milestone in space exploration.
Tan Dun (谭盾) is a Chinese-born American composer and conductor known for his film scores, including the Academy Award-winning music for Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon.
Wu Jing (吴京), also known as Jacky Wu, is a popular Chinese actor and director known for his roles in martial arts and action films such as Wolf Warrior.
Ma Huateng (马化腾), also known as Pony Ma, is the founder and CEO of Tencent, one of the largest technology companies in China.
Qian Xuesen (钱学森), known as the "Father of Chinese Rocketry," was a leading Chinese scientist instrumental in developing China’s missile and space programs.
He Zehui (何泽慧) was a pioneering Chinese nuclear physicist and particle physicist, often called the "Madame Curie of China."
Qian Sanqiang (钱三强) , also known as Tsien San-Tsiang, was a prominent Chinese nuclear physicist known as the "father of China’s atomic bomb."
Qian Weichang (钱伟长) was a pioneering Chinese physicist and mathematician known for his contributions to mechanics and engineering.
Yuan Longping (袁隆平), a Chinese agronomist and the "Father of Hybrid Rice," pioneered research that significantly boosted rice production, helping alleviate hunger worldwide.
Deng Jiaxian (邓稼先), also spelled as Chia-Hsien Teng, was a nuclear physicist who played a key role in the development of China’s nuclear weapons program.
Zhao Jiuzhang (赵九章), also known as Jeou Jang Jaw, was a meteorologist and space scientist, known for founding China's meteorology and space programs.
Lu Xun (鲁迅), a writer and father of modern Chinese literature, was known for his critical essays and short stories on social issues.
Liu Xiang (刘翔) is a Chinese Olympic gold medalist and former world record-holder in the 110-meter hurdles, considered one of China's greatest athletes.
Xu Beihong (徐悲鸿), also known as Ju Péon, was a Chinese artist known for his realistic paintings of horses and his role in modernizing Chinese art.
Li Bai (李白) was one of the most famous poets of the Tang Dynasty, known for his romantic and nature-themed poetry.
Fan Bingbing (范冰冰) is a Chinese actress, known for her roles in X-Men: Days of Future Past and various Chinese films.
Liu Wen (刘雯) is a Chinese model, widely regarded as China’s first supermodel and the first Chinese to walk the Victoria's Secret Fashion Show.
Wang Yujia (王羽佳), known as Yuja Wang, is a Chinese classical pianist celebrated for her exceptional technique and expressive performances.
Li Yundi (李云迪) is a Chinese pianist, known for winning the International Chopin Piano Competition at the age of 18.
Zhang Haochen (张昊辰) is a young Chinese pianist who won the gold medal at the 13th Van Cliburn International Piano Competition.
Sun Yang (孙杨) is a Chinese Olympic gold medalist and former world-record holder in swimming.
Guo Jingjing (郭晶晶) is a retired Chinese diver, regarded as one of the greatest female divers in history with multiple Olympic gold medals.
Lin Dan (林丹) is a retired Chinese badminton player, often considered one of the greatest in the sport, with two Olympic gold medals.
Deng Yaping (邓亚萍) is a retired Chinese table tennis player, regarded as one of the greatest in history with four Olympic golds.
Zhang Jike (张继科) is a former Chinese table tennis player, Olympic gold medalist, and multiple World Champion.
Wu Minxia (吴敏霞) is a retired Chinese diver, Olympic gold medalist, and one of the most decorated female divers in history.
Su Bingtian (苏炳添) is a Chinese sprinter, the first Asian to run the 100 meters in under 10 seconds, and a prominent figure in sprinting at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics.
Quan Hongchan (全红婵) is a Chinese diver who won two gold medals at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics at just 14 years old, making her one of the youngest Olympic gold medalists.
Gu Ailing (谷爱凌), also known as Eileen Feng Gu, is a freestyle skier, Gu became a breakout star at the Beijing 2022 Winter Olympics, winning two golds and a bronze in freestyle skiing events.
